img.title: We value our passionate and caring faculty, who are fully committed to actively engaging with colleagues, parents, and students to ensure success for every student.
img.alt: Photo of whole faculty at opening faculty orientation 2019

img.title: We value our collaborative community, which is an essential catalyst for academic growth, physical and emotional well being, and artistic expression.
img.alt: We value our collaborative community, which is an essential catalyst for academic growth, physical and emotional well being, and artistic expression.

img.title: We value the pursuit of academic excellence that develops knowledge of classical liberal arts and modern science.
We value strong relationships characterized by mutual respect and trust.
img.alt: We value strong relationships characterized by mutual respect and trust.

img.title: We value an awareness of and engagement with the world that compels students to active lives of service.
img.alt: We value an awareness of and engagement with the world that compels students to active lives of service.

img.title: We value compassion and inclusivity that create an environment where students are enriched by their differences and diversity is celebrated.
img.alt: We value compassion and inclusivity that create an environment where students are enriched by their differences and diversity is celebrated.

img.title: We value parental volunteerism and support, which is critical to achieving our mission.

div.p: We envision a world where every young person wholeheartedly engages inan extraordinary educational journey that leads to a life of leadership and service.
Woods Charter School empowers students to achieve their full potential. We develop young citizens equipped with a solid academic foundation, a passion for learning, and exemplary character.

a.title: Click to read more about: Woods Covid-19 FAQ

div.a: Read More about Woods Covid-19 FAQ
Guiding Principles for Woods Faculty as We (Temporarily) Venture down the Path of Distance Learning

p.span:
Posted March 18th
Our teachers continue to develop and refine their plans for the start of distance learning this coming Monday. Yesterday, we took a short pause and considered six guiding principles that Mr. Bryan proposed for the teachers as they proceed with their work.
Those interested in taking a look at thoseGuiding Principlesmay do so in two forms:
Same content. Different formats. You choose.

div.a: Benefit Auction: The Show Will Go On (in May)!

p.span: We have an update on our Annual Benefit Auction, originally scheduled for Friday, April 17th.

We apologize for the pivot in plans, but after further consideration of COVID-19 projections, we are going to postpone the Benefit Auction until May. We will communicate a date out two weeks prior to the event and are so looking forward to coming together, even if it is just digitally!
The Auction site is up if you'd like totake a lookand see some of the fantastic offerings that have been donated and will be up for bidding - new items are being added daily.
More news soon. Take care and stay well!
